content.body:
Probably not, but just in case…
Is there a way for ecmarkup to become aware of definitions from Ecma262 pull requests? I want a proposal spec to refer to the Decorator productions from #2417—and I want to suppress the grammar-shape errors resulting from the spec referring to those productions.

content.body: jschoi: check out the pr, run `ecmarkup --verbose --write-biblio whatever.json spec.html > /dev/null`; this will produce a `whatever.json` biblio file. in your proposal, do `ecmarkup --load-biblio ./whatever.json your-proposal.html`.

content.body: (the `./` is import because otherwise ecmarkup will attempt to load a node module named `whatever.json` which is not the thing you want)

content.body: because some of the checks are from grammarkdown, which doesn't really know about the biblio

content.body: Thank you very much! I think the PR’s biblio file will be sufficient. Looking forward to the biblio-format upgrade.

content.body: it is just a small tweak to make it better for other tooling: https://github.com/tc39/ecmarkup/pull/425
